choices.D: Sets the maximum length that any single event can reach to be included in the transaction.
choices.B: Sets the maximum length of all the events within a transaction.
choices.C: Sets the maximum total time between the earliest and latest events in a transaction.
choices.A: Sets the maximum total time between events in a transaction.

discussion.content: Correct answer is C
130 page of splk-1002. C is thee answer

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C

Answer is C:
maxspan Syntax: maxspan=<int>[s | m | h | d]
Description: Specifies the maximum length of time in seconds, minutes, hours, or days that the events can span. The events in the transaction must span less than integer specified for maxspan. Events that exceed the maxspan limit are treated as part of a separate transaction. If the value is negative, the maxspan constraint is disabled and there is no limit.
Default: -1 (no limit)
130 page of splk-1002. C is thee answer

maxspan -> first and last event 
maxpause -> between the events

Total time means start time+end time,
